page.title: 16 VILLIERS PARK-EDUCATIONAL
page.content: This is part of the Manor Charitable Trustees-it started in London in 1907,it was called the Eton Mission Boys' Club. Villiers Park is situated on the edge of Middleton Stoney and overlooks the private Middleton Park. One of the founders was Arthur Villiers and the park aquired its name from him. The trustees started "Reading Courses" in the school holidays for advaced students to get used to "University life" and could revise in peace for their exams. The first of these courses to be held at Villiers Park was in 1965. Arthur Villiers died in 1969 but the reading courses are still being held at Middleton Stoney,including industrial courses.
